column1: #Text=An hydraulic piston apparatus for use in a compression release engine retarder ( 10 ) , comprising a piston ( 20 ) which reciprocates along a reciprocation axis ( 18 ) , for coupling the motion of the piston in the engine retarder to the motion of an element ( 12 ) in the engine associated with the retarder which pivots about a pivot axis ( 16 ) which is transverse to the reciprocation axis ; a push rod ( 30 ) having a longitudinal axis which is generally aligned with the reciprocation axis ( 18 ) , a first surface ( 34 ) transverse to the longitudinal axis being associated with said push rod adjacent to the piston , and bearing means ( 40 ) adjacent to the end of the push rod ( 30 ) which is remote from said first surface for contacting said element ( 12 ) so that the bearing means ( 40 ) moves through an arc concentric with said pivot axis ( 16 ) when said element ( 12 ) pivots ; and a second surface ( 26 ) associated with said piston , said second surface being transverse to said reciprocation axis and in contact with said first surface ( 34 ) , and one of said first and second surfaces ( 34 , 26 ) being convex , characterized in that the other of said first and second surfaces ( 34 , 26 ) has a shape selected from the group consisting of substantially flat and convex .
#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 1 , wherein said first surface ( 34 ) is convex .
#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 2 , wherein said second surface ( 26 ) is flat .
#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 1 , wherein said one of said first and second surfaces has a radius of curvature of approximately 76.2cm ( 30 inches ) .

#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 1 , characterized in that means ( 50 ) is provided for resiliently biasing said longitudinal axis of said push rod ( 30 ) into substantial parallelism with said reciprocation axis ( 18 ) .

#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 5 , wherein said means for resiliently biasing comprises : means ( 50a , 50b ) for resiliently urging said piston to move along said reciprocation axis ( 18 ) in a direction away from said element ( 12 ) .

#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 6 , wherein said means for resiliently biasing comprises : a third surface ( 32 ) on said push rod ; a fourth surface on said piston ( 20 ) ; a member ( 52 ) in contact with both of said third and fourth surfaces when said longitudinal axis is parallel to said reciprocation axis ( 18 ) ; and a spring ( 50 ) for resiliently urging said member ( 52 ) into contact with both of said third and fourth surfaces .

#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 7 , wherein said third ( 32 ) and fourth surfaces are substantially concentric annular surfaces around said longitudinal axis which face toward said element ( 12 ) and which are substantially parallel to one another when said longitudinal axis is parallel to said reciprocation axis ( 18 ) .
#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 8 , wherein said third ( 32 ) and fourth surfaces are substantially co-planar when said longitudinal axis is parallel to said reciprocation axis ( 18 ) .

#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 9 , wherein said member ( 52 ) has an annular fifth surface substantially concentric with said third and fourth surfaces , said fifth surface being in substantially annular contact with both of said third and fourth surfaces when said longitudinal axis is parallel to said reciprocation axis ( 18 ) .

#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 5 , wherein said piston ( 20 ) reciprocates in a cylinder ( 22 ) in said retarder ( 10 ) , and wherein said means for resiliently biasing comprises : prestressed compression coil spring means ( 50a , 50b ) substantially concentric with said push rod , one end of said prestressed compression coil spring means bearing on said push rod ( 30 ) and said piston ( 20 ) , and the other end of said prestressed compression coil spring means bearing on a wall ( 56 ) of said cylinder ( 22 ) between said piston ( 20 ) and said element ( 12 ) .

#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 7 , wherein said piston reciprocates in a cylinder ( 22 ) in said retarder ( 10 ) , and wherein said spring ( 50 ) is a prestressed compression coil spring substantially concentric with said push rod ( 30 ) and having one end which bears on said member ( 52 ) opposite said third and fourth surfaces , and another end which acts on a wall ( 56 ) of said cylinder ( 22 ) between said piston ( 20 ) and said element ( 12 ) .
#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 1 , wherein said bearing means comprises : a foot ( 40 ) pivotably mounted on the end of said push rod ( 30 ) which is remote from said first surface ( 34 ) .
#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 13 , wherein said foot ( 40 ) has a ball and socket connection to said push rod ( 30 ) .
#Text=The apparatus defined in claim 13 , wherein said foot ( 40 ) is held to said push rod ( 30 ) by a spring clip ( 42 ) which is wrapped around both said push rod ( 30 ) and said foot ( 40 ) .
